solution_line_template: We know Eric has {eric_stars} stars and Chad has twice that amount, so Chad has {eric_stars} x {chad_multiplier} = {chad_stars_initial} stars.

Then Chad sells {stars_sold_to_jeff} of them to Jeff, so Chad has {chad_stars_initial} - {stars_sold_to_jeff} = <<{chad_stars_initial}-{stars_sold_to_jeff}={chad_stars_after_sale}>>{chad_stars_after_sale} stars.
Altogether, Eric has {eric_stars} + Chad has {chad_stars_after_sale} + Jeff has {jeff_stars_final} = <<{eric_stars}+{chad_stars_after_sale}+{jeff_stars_final}={total_stars}>>{total_stars} stars.
